unnormalised: **5G Rollout Accelerates Across India, Eyes Rural Connectivity**
normalised: five G rollout accelerates across India, eyes rural connectivity

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – The nationwide 5G rollout is gaining momentum, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio aggressively expanding their networks. Latest figures released by TRAI indicate significant progress, particularly in Tier 1 and Tier 2 cities.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – The nationwide five G rollout is gaining momentum, with Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio aggressively expanding their networks. Latest figures released by T R A I indicate significant progress, particularly in Tier one and Tier two cities.

unnormalised: Jio announced today, at 11:00 hrs, it has successfully completed 5G coverage in all 22 telecom circles, focusing on dense urban areas and major highways. Airtel reports similar progress, highlighting its partnership with state governments to expedite infrastructure deployment, including the laying of optical fiber cables.
normalised: Jio announced today, at eleven zero zero hours, it has successfully completed five G coverage in all twenty two telecom circles, focusing on dense urban areas and major highways. Airtel reports similar progress, highlighting its partnership with state governments to expedite infrastructure deployment, including the laying of optical fiber cables.

unnormalised: The government's "BharatNet" project, aiming to connect all Gram Panchayats with high-speed internet, is expected to be crucial in extending 5G services to rural India. It is speculated that connectivity in some of the rural regions of Rajasthan may only be functional by 31/12/2024. The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is also considering allocating additional spectrum in the 26 GHz band to further boost network capacity. The estimated investment in 5G infrastructure is expected to surpass Rs. 3.6 lakh crore by 2025. Next review meeting scheduled at 14:00 hrs on 15/11/2023.
normalised: The government's "BharatNet" project, aiming to connect all Gram Panchayats with high-speed internet, is expected to be crucial in extending five G services to rural India. It is speculated that connectivity in some of the rural regions of Rajasthan may only be functional by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. The Department of Telecommunications (D O T) is also considering allocating additional spectrum in the twenty six G H Z band to further boost network capacity. The estimated investment in five G infrastructure is expected to surpass rupees three point six lakh crore by two thousand and twenty five. Next review meeting scheduled at fourteen zero zero hours on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three.
